intro: Alsine picta, commonly known as the painted alsike, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in meadows and along stream banks. Alsine picta is often found in disturbed habitats and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
